decks.notes: This deck is focused on quickly and aggressively disrupting the opponent's hand and graveyard while also putting pressure on them with efficient creatures. It utilizes discard spells like Thoughtseize and Grief along with reanimation spells like Reanimate to quickly bring back powerful creatures. Dauthi Voidwalker and Mai, Scornful Striker provide additional disruption and protection, while Troll of Khazad-d√ªm and Boggart Trawler serve as strong beaters. The deck also includes some mana acceleration in the form of Lotus Petal, Mox Jet, and Dark Ritual to help cast its powerful spells quickly and efficiently.

This deck is built around assembling a powerful artifact-based aggro strategy that aims to disrupt the opponent's plays while quickly ramping up to a game-winning board state. By utilizing a combination of fast mana acceleration, disruptive artifacts like Chalice of the Void and Trinisphere, and powerful win conditions such as Mystic Forge and Karn, the Great Creator, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a combination of speed, resilience, and raw power. Additionally, the inclusion of key combo pieces like Time Vault and Manifold Key provide additional avenues for victory.

This deck focuses on assembling the Coveted Jewel combo as quickly as possible by utilizing mana acceleration and card draw. The key strategy involves generating mana with Ancient Tomb, Mishra's Workshop and Grim Monolith, using Paradoxical Outcome to draw more cards, and then casting Coveted Jewel to generate a massive amount of mana. Cards like Force of Will and Trinisphere help protect the combo, while cards like Tezzeret, Cruel Captain and The One Ring provide additional support. Overall, the deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a powerful combination of cards.

This deck focuses on utilizing Gifts Ungiven to search for key combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's game plan. It also utilizes control elements such as Force of Will, Mana Drain, and Mindbreak Trap to protect its combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's plays. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion provides additional value by allowing for repeated use of key cards from the graveyard. Overall, this deck aims to control the game through powerful spells and efficient card advantage to outmaneuver the opponent and secure victory.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's resources while applying pressure with efficient threats. It aims to control the game with disruptive creatures like Deathrite Shaman and Collector Ouphe, backed up by counterspells like Force of Will and Force of Negation. The deck also includes powerful cards like Oko, Thief of Crowns and Leovold, Emissary of Trest to generate advantage and slow down the opponent. The deck has a good balance of disruption and aggression, allowing it to adapt to different matchups and strategies.

The deck focuses on quickly assembling the key pieces needed to win the game in a single turn using the Doomsday combo. By using various tutors and card draw spells to find and set up the Doomsday stack, followed by using Thassa's Oracle to win the game by drawing a card from an empty library. The deck also includes a strong control package with counterspells like Force of Will and Flusterstorm to protect the combo and disrupt opponents' plans. The goal is to win the game in a swift and efficient manner before the opponent can respond.

The deck focuses on using a mix of powerful counterspells, card draw, and removal spells to control the game and disrupt the opponent's strategy. It also includes cards to generate card advantage and gain incremental advantages over time. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for extra value by recurring cheap permanents from the graveyard. With a strong control shell and multiple ways to disrupt the opponent's plans, the deck aims to outlast the opponent and eventually win the game through attrition and resource management.

This Esper Control deck focuses on using disruption and removal spells to control the game, along with card advantage from spells like Ancestral Recall and Dig Through Time. The deck also includes various mana acceleration and card selection with cards like Black Lotus and Gitaxian Probe. Lurrus of the Dream-Den provides additional value by allowing you to cast cheap permanents from your graveyard. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue opponents and disrupt their game plan while setting up its own win condition.

This deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy by playing powerful hatebears like Archon of Emeria and Chancellor of the Annex while also applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Clarion Conqueror and Seasoned Dungeoneer. The deck also utilizes mana acceleration with cards like Black Lotus and Moxen to ramp into its powerful threats quickly. The inclusion of cards like Anointed Peacekeeper and Void Mirror further disrupts the opponent's game plan, making it difficult for them to effectively cast spells and stabilize on the board.

This deck focuses on using the Phyrexian Dreadnought combo to quickly defeat opponents. By using cards like Force of Will, Force of Negation, and Lavinia, Azorius Renegade to protect and support the combo, the deck aims to control the game until it can bring out the Dreadnought and finish off the opponent with one powerful attack. With a mix of control elements and combo pieces, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents and secure quick wins in the Vintage 1 vs 1 format.

This deck focuses on disrupting your opponent's spells and mana while quickly building a board presence with efficient creatures. By using hatebears like Archon of Emeria and Chancellor of the Annex, along with aggro creatures like Clarion Conqueror and White Plume Adventurer, this deck aims to apply pressure early and prevent the opponent from casting their big spells with cards like Void Mirror. With mana acceleration from Moxen and Ancient Tomb, this deck can quickly overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy through counterspells and removal while generating card advantage with cards like Hullbreacher and Stock Up. The deck also has powerful win conditions in the form of Karn, the Great Creator, Time Vault combo with Voltaic Key, and Bolas's Citadel for card advantage and a potential game-ending storm turn. The deck aims to control the game early on, outvalue opponents with card advantage, and close out the game with powerful finishers.

This deck focuses on using control elements and card advantage to outmaneuver the opponent and ultimately win the game. It utilizes powerful cards like Gifts Ungiven, Yawgmoth's Will, and Time Vault to create advantageous board states and generate value. By carefully managing resources and making strategic plays, the pilot of this deck aims to control the game's tempo and establish dominance over the opponent, leading to a victory through superior decision-making and resource management.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's board and hand, using counterspells like Force of Will and Spell Pierce to disrupt their plays. It also utilizes powerful card draw spells like Ancestral Recall and Dig Through Time to maintain card advantage. Additionally, it includes disruptive creatures like Lavinia, Azorius Renegade and Psychic Frog to further control the opponent's strategy. The inclusion of disruptive lands like Wasteland and Strip Mine adds another layer of control, while utilizing powerful artifacts like Black Lotus and Moxen for mana acceleration. Overall, the deck aims to control the game and outvalue the opponent.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's mana base with land destruction while deploying hatebears to slow down their game plan. The Hatebears like Archon of Emeria and Chancellor of the Annex limit the opponent's options, while Anointed Peacekeeper and White Plume Adventurer provide early aggression. Cavern of Souls ensures the hatebears can't be countered, and Chrome Mox allows for faster deployment of threats. Seasoned Dungeoneer and Witch Enchanter provide card advantage, while cards like Void Mirror and Sol Ring further disrupt the opponent's strategy. Overall, the deck aims to control the game and overwhelm the opponent with disruptive creatures.

This Vintage Dimir Control deck aims to disrupt opponents while assembling a powerful combo involving Time Vault and Voltaic Key. It utilizes powerful artifacts like the Moxen and Black Lotus to quickly ramp up mana for early game plays. With a mix of counterspells, card draw, and tutors, the deck is designed to control the game and find the combo pieces needed to win. Karn, the Great Creator provides additional utility by shutting down opposing artifacts, while Tezzeret, Cruel Captain can help generate card advantage and finish off opponents.
